text:
Management of aortobronchial fistula with graft replacement and omentopexy.
 Massive hemoptysis due to a recurrent aortobronchial fistula after repair of a thoracic aortic aneurysm developed in a 64-year-old woman.
 The infected aortic tissue was resected and replaced with an in situ Dacron graft covered by omentum.
 The patient is alive and well 15 months later.
